title: Drawing, "Riverbank and Botanical Sketches from Higuerote, Ecuador", May 1853 ?
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at top left:  Long grassy banks / Guacamaya; again, at top right: small / leaves / very large tree/ this tree is marvellously beautiful / unbrelliferous and the leaves / hanging in masses of festoonr / medium green; and at center right: India /Rubber tree / leaves like lemon but / longer-somewhat shiny / Higuerote.
description: Horizontal group of sketches containing an elevated bank with a group of trees, at top left; tops of trees, at bottom left; details of a ceiba tree, at top right; and leaves, at center right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Riverbank and Botanical Sketches from Higuerote, Ecuador", May 1853 ?.
May 1853 ?. Graphite on gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-118.
